listitem.para: struct daos_cont_info_t
#define DAOS_COO_RO (1U << 0)
#define DAOS_COO_RW (1U << 1)
#define DAOS_COO_NOSLIP (1U << 2)
#define DAOS_COO_FORCE (1U << 3)
#define DAOS_COO_NBITS (4)
#define DAOS_COO_MASK ((1U << DAOS_COO_NBITS) - 1)
#define DAOS_SNAPSHOT_MAX_LEN 128
#define daos_cont_open(poh, co, ...)
#define daos_cont_destroy(poh, co, ...)
#define daos_cont_create(poh, co, ...)

section.title: daos_cont_create

para.computeroutput: #define daos_cont_create( poh, co, ...)

section.programlisting: ({ \ int _ret; \ uuid_t *_u; \ if (d_is_uuid(co)) { \ _u = (uuid_t *)((unsigned char *)(co)); \ _ret = daos_cont_create((poh), _u, \ __VA_ARGS__); \ } else { \ _u = (uuid_t *)(co); \ _ret = daos_cont_create2((poh), _u, \ __VA_ARGS__); \ } \ _ret; \ })
section.para: for backward compatility, support old api where a const uuid_t was required to be passed in for the container to be created.

para.computeroutput: #define daos_cont_destroy( poh, co, ...)

section.programlisting: ({ \ int _ret; \ char _str[37]; \ const char *__str = NULL; \ if (d_is_string(co)) { \ __str = (const char *)(co); \ } else if (d_is_uuid(co)) { \ uuid_unparse((unsigned char *)(co), _str); \ __str = _str; \ } \ _ret = daos_cont_destroy2((poh), __str, __VA_ARGS__); \ _ret; \ })
section.para: for backward compatility, support old api where a const uuid_t was used instead of a string to identify the container.

section.para: for backward compatility, support old api where a const uuid_t was used instead of a string to identify the container.

section.title: DAOS_COO_RO

para.computeroutput: #define DAOS_COO_RO (1U << 0)

section.para: DAOS_COO_RO opens the container for reading only. This flag conflicts with DAOS_COO_RW.
DAOS_COO_RW opens the container for reading and writing. This flag conflicts with DAOS_COO_RO.
DAOS_COO_NOSLIP disables the automatic epoch slip at epoch commit time. See daos_epoch_commit().
DAOS_COO_FORCE skips the check to see if the pool meets the redundancy factor/level requirements of the container.
Definition at line 38 of file daos_cont.h.

section.title: daos_snapshot_opts

para.computeroutput: enum daos_snapshot_opts

entry.para: create snapshot
create OI table for a snapshot

section.para: Definition at line 597 of file daos_cont.h.

section.title: daos_cont_aggregate()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_aggregate (daos_handle_t coh, daos_epoch_t epoch, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Trigger aggregation to specified epoch

entry.para: Container handle
Epoch to be aggregated to. Current time will be used when 0 is specified.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.title: daos_cont_alloc_oids()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_alloc_oids (daos_handle_t coh, daos_size_t num_oids, uint64_t * oid, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Allocate a unique set of 64 bit unsigned integers to be used for object ID generation for that container. This is an optional helper function for applications to use to guarantee unique object IDs on the container when more than 1 client are accessing objects on the container. The highest used ID is tracked in the container metadata for future access to that container. This doesn't guarantee that the IDs allocated are sequential; and several ID ranges could be discarded at container close.

entry.para: Container open handle.
Number of unique IDs requested.
starting oid that was allocated up to oid + num_oids.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container open handle -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable

section.title: daos_cont_close()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_close (daos_handle_t coh, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Close a container handle. Upon successful completion, the container handle's epoch hold (i.e., if LHE < DAOS_EPOCH_MAX) is released, and any uncommitted updates from the container handle are discarded.

entry.para: Container open handle.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle

section.title: daos_cont_create()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_create (daos_handle_t poh, uuid_t * uuid, daos_prop_t * cont_prop, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Create a new container on the storage pool connected by poh. The label (along with other container properties) can be passed via the cont_prop. If no label is specified, a container without any labels will be created. In this case, the only way to identify the newly created container will be via its UUID. It is thus recommended to pass a uuid argumnent so that the UUID allocated to the container can be returned to the caller.

entry.para: Pool connection handle.
Optional, pointer to uuid_t to hold the implementation-generated container UUID.
Optional, container properties pointer
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_HDL Invalid pool handle -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH network is unreachable

section.title: daos_cont_create2()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_create2 (daos_handle_t poh, uuid_t * uuid, daos_prop_t * cont_prop, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Backward compatibility code. Please don't use directly

section.title: daos_cont_create_snap()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_create_snap (daos_handle_t coh, daos_epoch_t * epoch, char * name, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Create a persistent snapshot at the current epoch and return it. The epoch that is returned can be used to create a read only transaction to read data from that persistent snapshot. Optionally the snapshot can be given a name as an attribute which can be retrieved with daos_cont_list_snap(). Name length can't exceed DAOS_SNAPSHOT_MAX_LEN.

entry.para: Container handle
returned epoch of persistent snapshot taken.
Optional null terminated name for snapshot.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.title: daos_cont_create_snap_opt()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_create_snap_opt (daos_handle_t coh, daos_epoch_t * epoch, char * name, enum daos_snapshot_opts opts, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para:
Advanced snapshot function, it can do different things based bits set in opts:
DAOS_SNAP_OPT_CR create a snapshot at the current epoch and return it.
DAOS_SNAP_OPT_OIT create object ID table (OIT) for the snapshot

entry.para: Container handle
returned epoch of persistent snapshot taken.
Optional null terminated name for snapshot.
Bit flags, see daos_snapshot_opts
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.title: daos_cont_create_with_label()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_create_with_label (daos_handle_t poh, const char * label, daos_prop_t * cont_prop, uuid_t * uuid, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Create a new container with label label on the storage pool connected by poh. Helper method built over the regular daos_cont_create().

entry.para: Pool connection handle.
Required, label property of the new container. Supersedes any label specified in cont_prop.
Optional, container properties pointer that if specified must not include an entry with type DAOS_PROP_CO_LABEL.
Optional, pointer to uuid_t to hold the implementation-generated container UUID.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_HDL Invalid pool handle -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH network is unreachable

section.title: daos_cont_del_attr()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_del_attr (daos_handle_t coh, int n, char const *const names[], daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Delete a list of user-defined container attributes.

entry.para: Container handle
Number of attributes
Array of n null-terminated attribute names.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle -DER_NOMEM Out of memory

section.title: daos_cont_delete_acl()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_delete_acl (daos_handle_t coh, enum daos_acl_principal_type type, d_string_t name, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Remove a principal's entry from a container's ACL.

entry.para: Container handle
Principal type to be removed
Name of principal to be removed (if type is user or group)
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle -DER_NOMEM Out of memory -DER_NONEXIST Principal is not in the ACL

section.title: daos_cont_destroy()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_destroy (daos_handle_t poh, const char * cont, int force, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Destroy a container identified by cont, a label or UUID string associated with the container. All objects within this container will be destroyed. If there is at least one container opener, and force is set to zero, then the operation completes with DER_BUSY. Otherwise, the container is destroyed when the operation completes.

entry.para: Pool connection handle.
Label or UUID string to idenfity the container to destroy
Container destroy will return failure if the container is still busy (outstanding open handles). This parameter will force the destroy to proceed even if there is an outstanding open handle.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. Function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NONEXIST Container is nonexistent -DER_BUSY Pool is busy

section.title: daos_cont_destroy2()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_destroy2 (daos_handle_t poh, const char * cont, int force, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Backward compatibility code. Please don't use directly

section.title: daos_cont_destroy_snap()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_destroy_snap (daos_handle_t coh, daos_epoch_range_t epr, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Destroy a snapshot. The epoch corresponding to the snapshot is not discarded, but may be aggregated.

entry.para: Container handle
Epoch range of snapshots to destroy. If epr_lo == epr_hi delete 1 snapshot at epr_lo/hi. If epr_lo == 0, delete all snapshots <= epr_hi. If epr_hi == DAOS_EPOCH_MAX, delete all snapshots >= epr_lo.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.title: daos_cont_get_acl()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_get_acl (daos_handle_t container, daos_prop_t ** acl_prop, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Query the container Access Control List and ownership properties.

entry.para: Container open handle.
Newly allocated daos_prop_t containing the ACL, owner, and owner-group properties of the container. Caller must free it with daos_prop_free().
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle

section.title: daos_cont_get_attr()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_get_attr (daos_handle_t coh, int n, char const *const names[], void *const buffers[], size_t sizes[], daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Retrieve a list of user-defined container attribute values.

entry.para: Container handle
Number of attributes
Array of n null-terminated attribute names.

Array of n buffers to store attribute values. Attribute values larger than corresponding buffer sizes will be truncated. NULL values are permitted and will be treated identical to zero-length buffers, in which case only the sizes of attribute values will be retrieved.
[in]: Array of n buffer sizes. [out]: Array of actual sizes of n attribute values, regardless of given buffer sizes.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.title: daos_cont_global2local()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_global2local (daos_handle_t poh, d_iov_t glob, daos_handle_t * coh)

section.para: Create a local container handle for global representation data.

entry.para: Pool connection handle the container belong to
Global (shared) representation of a collective handle to be extracted
Returned local container handle

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned: non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_HDL Pool handle is nonexistent

section.title: daos_cont_list_attr()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_list_attr (daos_handle_t coh, char * buffer, size_t * size, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: List the names of all user-defined container attributes.

entry.para: Container handle.

Buffer containing concatenation of all attribute names, each being null-terminated. No truncation is performed and only full names will be returned. NULL is permitted in which case only the aggregate size will be retrieved.
[in]: Buffer size. [out]: Aggregate size of all attribute names (excluding terminating null characters), regardless of the actual buffer size.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.title: daos_cont_list_snap()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_list_snap (daos_handle_t coh, int * nr, daos_epoch_t * epochs, char ** names, daos_anchor_t * anchor, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: List all the snapshots of a container and optionally retrieve the snapshot name of each one if it was given at create time.

entry.para: Container handle
[in]: Number of snapshots in epochs and names. [out]: Actual number of snapshots returned.
preallocated array of epochs to store snapshots.
preallocated array of names of the snapshots. DAOS_SNAPSHOT_MAX_LEN can be used for each name size if not known.
Hash anchor for the next call, it should be set to zeroes for the first call, it should not be changed by caller between calls.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.title: daos_cont_local2global()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_local2global (daos_handle_t coh, d_iov_t * glob)

section.para: Convert a local container handle to global representation data which can be shared with peer processes. If glob->iov_buf is set to NULL, the actual size of the global handle is returned through glob->iov_buf_len. This function does not involve any communication and does not block.

entry.para: valid local container handle to be shared
pointer to iov of the buffer to store handle information

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned: non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_HDL Container handle is nonexistent -DER_TRUNC Buffer in glob is too short, larger buffer required. In this case the required buffer size is returned through glob->iov_buf_len.

section.title: daos_cont_open()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_open (daos_handle_t poh, const char * cont, unsigned int flags, daos_handle_t * coh, daos_cont_info_t * info, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Open an existing container identified by cont, a label or UUID string. Upon successful completion, coh and info, both of which shall be allocated by the caller, return the container handle and the latest container information respectively.

entry.para: Pool connection handle.
Label or UUID string to identify the container.
Open mode, represented by the DAOS_COO_ bits.
Returned open handle.
Optional, return container information
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_NONEXIST Container is nonexistent -DER_RF #failures exceed RF, data possibly lost

section.title: daos_cont_open2()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_open2 (daos_handle_t poh, const char * cont, unsigned int flags, daos_handle_t * coh, daos_cont_info_t * info, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Backward compatibility code. Please don't use directly

section.title: daos_cont_overwrite_acl()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_overwrite_acl (daos_handle_t coh, struct daos_acl * acl, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Overwrites the container ACL with a new one.

entry.para: Container handle
New ACL to write
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle

section.title: daos_cont_query()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_query (daos_handle_t container, daos_cont_info_t * info, daos_prop_t * cont_prop, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Query container information.

entry.para: Container open handle.
Returned container information.

Optional, returned container properties If it is NULL, then needs not query the properties. If cont_prop is non-NULL but its dpp_entries is NULL, will query all pool properties, DAOS internally allocates the needed buffers and assign pointer to dpp_entries. If cont_prop's dpp_nr > 0 and dpp_entries is non-NULL, will query the properties for specific dpe_type(s), DAOS internally allocates the needed buffer for dpe_str or dpe_val_ptr, if the dpe_type with immediate value then will directly assign it to dpe_val. User can free the associated buffer by calling daos_prop_free().
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle

section.title: daos_cont_rollback()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_rollback (daos_handle_t coh, daos_epoch_t epoch, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Rollback to a specific persistent snapshot.

entry.para: Container handle
Epoch of a persistent snapshot to rollback to.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.para: Create or update a list of user-defined container attributes.

Array of n attribute values
Array of n elements containing the sizes of respective attribute values.

section.para: Update a container's owner user and/or owner group.

New owner user (NULL if not updating)
New owner group (NULL if not updating)
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle -DER_NOMEM Out of memory

Property entries to update

section.title: daos_cont_status_clear()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_status_clear (daos_handle_t coh, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Clear container status, to clear container's DAOS_PROP_CO_STATUS property from DAOS_PROP_CO_UNCLEAN status to DAOS_PROP_CO_HEALTHY (with same purpose with "daos cont set-prop --properties=status:healthy --pool= --cont= ".

entry.para: Container handle
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle

section.title: daos_cont_subscribe()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_subscribe (daos_handle_t coh, daos_epoch_t * epoch, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Subscribe to the container snapshot state. If user specifies a valid epoch, the call will return once a persistent snapshot has been taken at that epoch or a greater one. The epoch value will be updated with that epoch. If multiple snapshots exist at an epoch greater than the one specified, the lowest one will be returned in the epoch value. If the epoch value passed in is 0, this call will return the lowest persistent snapshot on the container, if any exist, otherwise will just wait till a persistent snapshot is created.

entry.para: Container handle
[in]: Epoch of snapshot to wait for. [out]: epoch of persistent snapshot that was taken.
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

section.title: daos_cont_update_acl()

para.computeroutput: int daos_cont_update_acl (daos_handle_t coh, struct daos_acl * acl, daos_event_t * ev)

section.para: Add new entries and/or update existing entries in a container's ACL.
If an entry already exists in the container's ACL for a principal in the passed-in ACL, the entry will be replaced with the new one. Otherwise, a new entry will be added.

entry.para: Container handle
ACL containing new/updated entries
Completion event, it is optional and can be NULL. The function will run in blocking mode if ev is NULL.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: These values will be returned by ev::ev_error in non-blocking mode: 0 Success -DER_INVAL Invalid parameter -DER_NO_PERM Permission denied -DER_UNREACH Network is unreachable -DER_NO_HDL Invalid container handle

section.title: daos_rank_list_parse()

para.computeroutput: d_rank_list_t* daos_rank_list_parse (const char * str, const char * sep)

section.para: Generate a rank list from a string with a separator argument. This is a convenience function to generate the rank list required by daos_pool_connect().

entry.para: string with the rank list
separator of the ranks in str. dmg uses ":" as the separator.

formalpara.title: Returns
formalpara.para: allocated rank list that user is responsible to free with d_rank_list_free().
